alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Marshall; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 29 at 9:00PM CDT until October 31 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FROST ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 30 possible. * WHERE...In Arkansas, Lee AR County. In Mississippi, DeSoto, Marshall, Tunica and Tate Counties. In Tennessee, Shelby County. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
